authority.name: A.B.E. — Constitutional Funding Forensics (CFF)
authority.description: Models how federal funds are used relative to statutory authority and mission constraints.

mission_classes.label: On-mission
mission_classes.description: Spending that is squarely within statutory authority and program purpose as enacted by Congress.

mission_classes.label: Off-mission
mission_classes.description: Spending that is outside statutory authority, beyond program purpose, or conflicts with controlling federal law.

mission_classes.label: Unclear / Needs Audit
mission_classes.description: Spending that cannot be cleanly classified without deeper document review, Single Audit work, or IG/GAO findings.

statutory_scope.description: How closely the funded activity tracks the text and intent of the authorizing statute and appropriation language.

appropriation_clarity.description: Whether the funding line is clearly documented, traceable to a lawful purpose, and not used to backdoor unrelated programs.

oversight_signal.description: Signals from IG, GAO, OMB, or Single Audit findings that indicate diversion, misuse, or repeat noncompliance.

off_mission_risk_index.description: 0–100 index of how much of the portfolio is plainly off-mission.

uncertainty_index.description: 0–100 index of how much funding is insufficiently documented or ambiguous.

portfolio_summary.low_risk: This funding portfolio is largely aligned with statutory mission. Off-mission spending appears limited and well below typical red-flag thresholds. CFF classifies this as LOW RISK but recommends periodic review of ambiguous lines.
portfolio_summary.moderate_risk: This portfolio shows meaningful off-mission or unclear spending. CFF classifies this as MODERATE RISK. A targeted review of OFF_MISSION and UNCLEAR line items is recommended, with priority on those tied to enforcement or high-impact programs.
portfolio_summary.high_risk: This portfolio contains substantial off-mission or poorly documented spending relative to statutory authority. CFF classifies this as HIGH RISK for constitutional, fiscal, and oversight exposure. IG, GAO, or legislative review is likely warranted.

line_item_notes.on_mission: This line item appears consistent with the authorizing statute and stated program purpose.
line_item_notes.off_mission: This line item appears to fund activities outside statutory scope or contrary to federal limitations. It should be reviewed for potential diversion or misuse.
line_item_notes.unclear: This line item lacks sufficient detail to confirm alignment. Additional documentation, program files, or audit work are required.

ciri.description: Aggregate OFF_MISSION amount (or a chosen subset) can be passed into CIRI as a policy_corrections value when those off-mission uses drive unconstitutional enforcement or harm.

affe.description: AFFE reads CFF outputs to visualize where realignment and reprogramming of funding would relieve constitutional and economic pressure.

integration_notes: CFF does not determine criminal intent or liability; it highlights structural funding misalignment that other actors (courts, auditors, IGs, legislatures) must evaluate.
CFF outputs are deterministic from the inputs.csv: same file, same classification, same metrics.
